revised_title: A Simple Resonance Method for Measuring Dielectric Constants
tldr: The authors describe a simple and reliable resonance method for measuring dielectric constants of dilute solutions to determine dipole moments in molecular structure. They explain the construction and operation of the apparatus, which uses a quartz crystal oscillator and a resonance circuit with a thermo-junction for detecting resonance. This method is suitable for measuring dielectric constants of solutions and has proven useful in various experiments.
